com.inepex.inecharting.chartwidget.model
Class ModelManager

java.lang.Object
  com.inepex.inecharting.chartwidget.model.ModelManager

public class ModelManager
extends java.lang.Object

An utility class for managing the IneChart's underlying model.

Author:
Miklós Süveges / Inepex Ltd.

Constructor Summary
ModelManager(IneChartProperties properties)
           
 
Method Summary
 void addDistanceToAllPoints(Curve curve, double dx)
          When adding a curve to the chart, which has a lower xMin than the actual, there's no need to recalculate all the points of all curves, just shift them with the (positive) difference between the new and the old xMin (and do not forget to do this with the curve's visualizer!)
 void calculateAndSetPointsForInterval(Curve curve, double start, double stop)
          Updates a curve's calculatedPoints container with the points calculated at the given data interval.
 double[] calculateDataIntervalXForPoint(int x, boolean mathematicalRounding)
          Creates an interval in the underlying data's dimension for an x (pixel) position in canvas
 int calculateDistance(double dx)
          Distance translation from data to canvas
 double calculateDistance(int dxInPx)
          Distance translation from canvas to data
 double calculateX(double x)
          Translates a datapoint's x value to the canvas' coordinate system
 double calculateY(double y, double minValue, double maxValue)
          Translates a datapoint's y value to the canvas' coordinate system
 void filterOverlappingPoints(Curve curve, double start, double stop)
          Filters a curve's calculatedPoints to extend the pointsToDraw container, based on curve's related policies.
 int getChartCanvasHeight()
           
 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> getDataForPoint(Point point)

addDistanceToAllPoints

public void addDistanceToAllPoints(Curve curve,
                                   double dx)
When adding a curve to the chart, which has a lower xMin than the actual, there's no need to recalculate all the points of all curves, just shift them with the (positive) difference between the new and the old xMin (and do not forget to do this with the curve's visualizer!)

Parameters:
curve -
dx -

getDataForPoint

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> getDataForPoint(Point point)
Returns x value(s in case of imaginary Point)(from the datamap) for a point

Parameters:
point -
Returns:
can return an empty list if the point is not in calculatedPoints, neither in pointsToDraw collection
